Posts.Content: Hi Everyone I am waiting for fec chemo which starts on the16th nov. I had a stage 2 grade 3 taken out by lumpectomy. The results were both er and pr sensitive and i was shocked to be told i would need chemo as only 43 and am single with 3 children (well actually 5 children but 2 have grown up). " things keep going through my head...1. my hair!!!! 2... i worry about my children seeing me unwell and not coping they are 5,11 and 14, boy girl girl respectively. Have been told to give up work as a childminder (and germs) and cant as i am the only one paying the mortgage. I am not losing the house i have worked so hard to keep for us all as well as a part of my breast and my hair!!! here is hoping i get very small side effects as i would wish all others xx Tracey
Posts.Title: FEC Chemo and side effects.

Posts.Content: Thank you all for the replies.. I have cut my hair short today and amazingly i did not cry. I have got another childminder on back up and all parents are happy and my children all know what is going on and have been very supportive and thank god seem ok. I am so happy that we were all very calm and laid back before this all came along as we have all taken this well and not dropped any of us into despair!!! Now the rest is up to my body and how it copes and i am going to take each day as it comes . I wish everyone good luck xxxx
Posts.Title: FEC Chemo and side effects.

Posts.Content: yes i had the flu jabs before chemo. Feel so much better now and am so glad you were not feeling like i was. I felt like i had flu without the virus. I am now going to take things easy and see how life takes me and start again on the 7th. Tracey
Posts.Title: FEC Chemo and side effects.

Posts.Content: Hello Thanks for the mail . Had my first chemo as planned on the 16th and  felt ok until wed andfelt exhausted. Spent 4 days in bed and then over the weekend started developing kidney infection. today went to doctor and have antibiotics and loads of cranberry and raspberry juice but the exhaustion is lifting and i do not feel so down.... how are you feeling???? Its my daughters birthday on the 2nd and i think and hope i will be well enough to enjoy it!! Lovely bruise from the chemogoing in!! My veins decided to take a hike on the day so i became a pin cushion lol. NO sickness long shallit continue lol. Looking forward to not shaving.  Trying the wigs on wed the 25th nov. Sorry didnotget online i wasjust too tired over the last few days. Tracey
